info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 4:25PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern McDowell, southeastern Mitchell, southwestern Avery, east central Yancey and northwestern Burke Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 425 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Spruce Pine, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Spruce Pine, Linville Falls, Table Rock, B.R. Parkway-Little Switzerland To Linville, B.R. Parkway-Craggy To Little Switzerland, B.R. Parkway-Linville Falls To Grandfather, North Cove, Ashford, Little Switzerland and Ingalls. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
